@Reconstructor_2D/step_length.m

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 % =====================================================================
00002 %> @brief % step_length calculates optimal steps alpha and beta
00003 %> by minimizing |c-Se(i+1| norm for next step
00004 %> e(i+1)=e(i) + a inv(S'(SS'+uI))(c-Se(i))
00005 %>
00006 %> @param S  - sensitivity matrix
00007 %> @param Cr - vector of capacitances to be measured for current estimation of Ep
00008 %> @param Cm - vector of measured capacitances
00009 %> @param Ep - current estimation of permittivity distribution (column vector)
00010 %> @param Epp - previous estimation of permittivity distribution (column vector)
00011 %> @param u    - Thikonov regularization factor for matrix pseudo inverse
00012 %> @retval alpha,beta optimal step lengths
00013 % =====================================================================
00014 function [a b] = step_length(rec_obj,S,Cr,Cm,Ep,Epp,u)
00015 
00016 
00017 H = S*S'*inv(S*S' + u*diag(diag(S*S'))); 
00018 e = Cm-Cr;   % Cr=SEp
00019 d = Ep-Epp;
00020 
00021 A(1,1) = (H*e)'*H*e;
00022 A(1,2) = (H*e)'*S*d;
00023 A(2,1) = (H*e)'*S*d;
00024 A(2,2) = (S*d)'*S*d;
00025 
00026 y(1,1) = e'*H*e;
00027 y(2,1) = e'*S*d;
00028 
00029 x = pinv(A)*y;
00030 
00031 a=x(1);
00032 b=x(2);
